result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Derrick D Morehead

records.addlTxt:
Branch 4 in jury trial on another case. State to provide any missing discovery. Defense requests additional time. Case adjourned in Branch 4.
Status conference scheduled for November 14, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

Attorney Anthony D Cotton in court, defendant Derrick D Morehead not in court, in custody.  Chad Wozniak appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for scheduling conference. Discovery and offer received. Defense requests more time for review. Case remains calendared in Branch 4.  Status conference scheduled for September 22, 2022 at 01:33 pm.

Defendant Derrick D Morehead in court with Attorney Anthony D Cotton.  Defendant Derrick D Morehead in custody.  Edward OBrien appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case set for a Preliminary Hearing. Parties are advised that this case is assigned to Branch 04, Judge Hanrahan. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing. Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court held colloquy with defendant. Probable cause has been found and the defendant is bound over for trial. Original Information e-filed, copy given to defense counsel who waived reading. Defense enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of the defendant. Case is adjourned to Br. 04.  Scheduling conference scheduled for August 5, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.
Court oredered co-defendants be kept separate while in custody.

Court ordered no contact with Effie P.G.; Octavia L.G.; and co-def:Trevante Ramone Young
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.

Defendant Derrick D Morehead in court with attorney Anthony D Cotton.  Defendant Derrick D Morehead in custody.  Kelly O'Neill appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Derrick D Morehead appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Hanrahan, Branch 04. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  
This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  
Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 26, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
